Submodules¶

hive.model.base module¶

class hive.model.base.Base[source]¶

Represents a base within the simulation.

Parameters

  • id (str) – unique base id.

  • geoid (GeoId) – location of base.

  • total_stalls (int) – total number of parking stalls.

  • available_stalls (int) – number of available parking stalls.

  • station_id (Optional[StationId]) – Optional station that is located at the base.

classmethod from_row(row: Dict[str, str], sim_h3_resolution: int) → Union[OSError, hive.model.base.Base][source]¶

takes a csv row and turns it into a Base

Parameters

  • row – a row as interpreted by csv.DictReader

  • sim_h3_resolution – the h3 resolution that events are experienced at

Returns

a Base, or an error

has_available_stall() → bool[source]¶

Does base have a stall or not.

Returns

Boolean

checkout_stall() → Optional[hive.model.base.Base][source]¶

Checks out a stall and returns the updated base if there are enough stalls.

Returns

Updated Base or None

return_stall() → Optional[hive.model.base.Base][source]¶

Checks out a stall and returns the updated base.

Returns

Updated Base

hive.model.request module¶

class hive.model.request.Request[source]¶

Bases: tuple

a ride hail request which is alive in the simulation but not yet serviced. it should only exist if the current sim time >= self.departure_time. it should be removed once the current sim time == self.cancel_time. if a vehicle has been dispatched to service this Request, then it should

origin¶
destination¶
departure_time¶
cancel_time¶
passengers¶
dispatched_vehicle¶
dispatched_vehicle_time¶
classmethod build(request_id: str, origin: str, destination: str, departure_time: int, cancel_time: int, passengers: int) → hive.model.request.Request[source]¶

constructor which tests assertions about the arguments for this Request :param request_id: :param origin: :param destination: :param departure_time: :param cancel_time: :param passengers: :return:

classmethod from_row(row: Dict[str, str], road_network: hive.model.roadnetwork.roadnetwork.RoadNetwork) → Union[OSError, hive.model.request.Request][source]¶

takes a csv row and turns it into a Request :param row: a row as interpreted by csv.DictReader :param road_network: the road network loaded for this simulation :return: a Request, or an error

assign_dispatched_vehicle(vehicle_id: str, current_time: int) → hive.model.request.Request[source]¶

allows the dispatcher to update the request that a vehicle has been dispatched to them. this does not signal that the vehicle is guaranteed to pick them up. :param vehicle_id: the vehicle that is planning to service the request :param current_time: the current simulation time :return: the updated Request

update_origin(geoid: str) → hive.model.request.Request[source]¶

used to override a request’s origin location as the centroid of the spatial grid, to make guarantees about what conditions will make requests overlap with vehicles. :param geoid: :return:

classmethod from_string(string: str, road_network: hive.model.roadnetwork.roadnetwork.RoadNetwork) → Union[OSError, hive.model.vehicle.Vehicle][source]¶

reads a csv row from file to generate a Vehicle

Parameters

string – a row of a .csv which matches hive.util.pattern.vehicle_regex.

this string will be stripped of whitespace characters (no spaces allowed in names!) :param road_network: the road network, used to find the vehicle’s location in the sim :return: a vehicle, or, an IOError if failure occurred.
